channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Promoting a movie in 2025 is a performance in itself
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Nicholas Quah of Vulture about the evolution of celebrity publicity as the "new media circuit" commands more attention.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Nicholas Quah of Vulture about the evolution of celebrity publicity as the "new media circuit" commands more attention.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: 10 passion projects that stood out at the movies this year
item.description: NPR critic Bob Mondello narrows down his favorite movies of the year — the ones that made audiences vibrate.
item.content:encoded:
NPR critic Bob Mondello narrows down his favorite movies of the year — the ones that made audiences vibrate.

(Image credit: NEON)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Cecilia Giménez, the artist who 'restored' the face of Jesus, has died at 94
item.description: Giménez international attention after she attempted to restore an old fresco. While it was immediately ridiculed at the time, the piece eventually turned into a tourist attraction.
item.content:encoded:
Giménez international attention after she attempted to restore an old fresco. While it was immediately ridiculed at the time, the piece eventually turned into a tourist attraction.

(Image credit: Javier Vinuela)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: What being around death taught this hospital chaplain about life
item.description: J.S. Park helps patients and their families cope with death every day as a hospital chaplain. He explains what to expect as a person is dying, and how to reckon with uncomfortable feelings about death.
item.content:encoded: J.S. Park helps patients and their families cope with death every day as a hospital chaplain. He explains what to expect as a person is dying, and how to reckon with uncomfortable feelings about death.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Just because she won a Nobel doesn't mean Malala didn't break some rules in college
item.description: In 2014, Malala Yousafzai became the youngest person to win a Nobel Prize. In Finding My Way, she writes about her life at Oxford and beyond. Originally broadcast Oct. 21, 2025.
item.content:encoded: In 2014, Malala Yousafzai became the youngest person to win a Nobel Prize. In Finding My Way, she writes about her life at Oxford and beyond. Originally broadcast Oct. 21, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: A critic's year-end 'ghost list' wanders from Italian movie sets to 'Demon Hunters'
item.description: Critic-at-large John Powers gives his due to the movies, TV and books he wasn't able to cover earlier in the year, including La Grazia, Andor, Mississippi Blue 42 and the documentary Mr. Scorsese.
item.content:encoded: Critic-at-large John Powers gives his due to the movies, TV and books he wasn't able to cover earlier in the year, including La Grazia, Andor, Mississippi Blue 42 and the documentary Mr. Scorsese.
item.dc:creator: John Powers

item.title: A top chef weighs in on recipe ideas for the Kwanzaa table
item.description: The weeklong celebration of Kwanzaa is a perfect opportunity to revisit soothing, hearty winter foods, says celebrity chef Tanya Holland.
item.content:encoded: The weeklong celebration of Kwanzaa is a perfect opportunity to revisit soothing, hearty winter foods, says celebrity chef Tanya Holland.
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: A college student in her 60s shares wisdom when it comes to reinventing oneself
item.description: Joan Steidl, who is now retired, shares her reinvention takeaways. She has a podcast about confronting the generational divide, takes comedy workshops and went back to college.
item.content:encoded: Joan Steidl, who is now retired, shares her reinvention takeaways. She has a podcast about confronting the generational divide, takes comedy workshops and went back to college.

item.title: 'Raising questions' isn't enough. The best films of the year took a stance
item.description: Now is not the time for subtlety, nostalgia or neutrality on screen.
item.content:encoded: Now is not the time for subtlety, nostalgia or neutrality on screen.
item.dc:creator: Aisha Harris

item.title: Genre fiction and female authors top U.S. libraries' most-borrowed lists in 2025
item.description: All of the top 10 books borrowed through the public library app Libby were written by women. And Kristin Hannah's The Women was the top checkout in many library systems around the country.
item.content:encoded:
All of the top 10 books borrowed through the public library app Libby were written by women. And Kristin Hannah's The Women was the top checkout in many library systems around the country.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby
